001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.animation;
002
003import java.awt.Dimension;
004import java.awt.Point;
005import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
006import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
007import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
008
009/**
010 * Animates an object moving smoothly in a direction and then bouncing back.
011 *
012 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
013 */
014public class BumpAnimation extends AbstractAnimation {
015
016    /**
017     * Creates a bump animation that will travel one cell in the given direction and return to the
018     * starting position in the given time, in milliseconds.
019     *
020     * @param image the image to be animated
021     * @param start the starting location of the image
022     * @param cellSize the size of the cell that the animation will take place in
023     * @param direction the direction the bump will happen in
024     * @param duration the number of milliseconds the animation should take in total
025     */
026    public BumpAnimation(BufferedImage image, Point start, Dimension cellSize, Direction direction, long duration) {
027        this(image, start, new Point(start.x + direction.deltaX * cellSize.width, start.y + direction.deltaY * cellSize.height), duration);
028    }
029
030    public BumpAnimation(BufferedImage image, Point start, Point end, long duration) {
031        super(image, start, end, duration);
032    }
033
034    @Override
035    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent ae) {
036        lastTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
037        if (isActive()) {
038            float ratio = (lastTime - startTime) / (endTime - startTime);
039            ratio = ratio > 0.5f ? 1.0f - ratio : Math.max(ratio, 0.001f);
040
041            float dx = end.x - start.x;
042            float dy = end.y - start.y;
043            dx *= ratio;
044            dy *= ratio;
045
046            label.setLocation(start.x + Math.round(dx), start.y + Math.round(dy));
047
048            label.invalidate();
049        }
050    }
051}
